summary: An app store application called Champ Playstore, similar to Google Play Store, where users can browse, search, and discover apps with categories, ratings, and detailed app pages
architectural_notes: App store UI similar to Google Play Store design patterns
Will require app metadata structure (name, description, category, ratings, screenshots)
Consider grid/list view layouts for app browsing
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Modern app store hero banner with vibrant gradient background and digital marketplace theme (hero-banner.dim_1200x400.png)
- Placeholder app icon for Games category showing game controller symbol (icon-games.dim_128x128.png)
- Placeholder app icon for Social category showing people connection symbol (icon-social.dim_128x128.png)
- Placeholder app icon for Productivity category showing checklist or tools symbol (icon-productivity.dim_128x128.png)
- Placeholder app icon for Entertainment category showing play or media symbol (icon-entertainment.dim_128x128.png)
- Placeholder app icon for Education category showing book or graduation cap symbol (icon-education.dim_128x128.png)
- Placeholder app icon for Tools category showing wrench or settings symbol (icon-tools.dim_128x128.png)

existing_features.title: Build a home page displaying featured apps, popular apps (sorted by download count), and category sections with horizontal scrollable app cards showing app icon, name, developer, and rating
Create a search interface with a prominent search bar that filters apps in real-time as users type, displaying matching results with app icons, names, categories, and ratings
Implement category browsing pages showing all apps within a selected category with grid layout, sorting options (by popularity, rating, name), and filtering capabilities
Build detailed app pages showing full app information including large icon, screenshots gallery, full description, developer info, version details, file size, ratings summary, and user reviews list
Create a review submission interface on app detail pages allowing users to select a star rating and write a text review, then submit it to the backend

Design a vibrant, modern app store interface with a bold color scheme inspired by digital marketplaces, featuring card-based layouts, smooth transitions, clear typography hierarchy, and engaging visual elements that create an inviting browsing experience

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a backend data model for apps including fields: app ID, name, description, developer name, category, version, file size, rating (0-5 scale), number of reviews, download count, icon URL, screenshots array, and release date
Implement backend functions to retrieve all apps, get apps by category, search apps by name or developer, and get individual app details by ID
Create a backend system for app categories including predefined categories like Games, Social, Productivity, Entertainment, Education, and Tools
Implement a ratings and reviews system in the backend where users can submit ratings (1-5 stars) and text reviews for apps, with the ability to calculate and update average ratings
